moves.1. d4 d5 2. e3 a6: Here, not interest about the center.
moves.3. Nf3 Nc6 4. Be2 g6 5. Nbd2 e6 6. O-O B: Queen side has some gaps among the Pawns. So, White pieces can attack.
moves.8... Bb7 9. Bb2 Qe7 10. b4 Nf6 11. a4 O-: Now, white Pawns creep slowly into the black side.
moves.12... axb5 13. Bxb5: White side got a Pawn up.
moves.13... Na7 14. Be2 c6 15. Ba3: Here, coming a discover attack. Black Queen and Rook would be in danger.
moves.15... Ne8: Black side observed it and may be get ready for it.
moves.16... Nd6 17. bxc6: Another Pawn was earned. Black side can recover it. Watch for it.
See, how the Knight got developed.
moves.23... Rfd8 24. Rxa8: Now white like to have to exchange the pieces, looking for Rooks at the beginning.
moves.24... Rxa8 25. Qb1: Now looking to exchange the Queens. Does the other side agree?
moves.26. Bg3 f6 27. Rd1 Rd8 28. Bb5 Rc8 29. B: Instead of it, an exchange of Bishop and Knight !
moves.29... Qxc6 30. Qd3 Qa4 31. Bd6 Rc6 32. B: This time, of course white can get rid of the Rooks. May be can think about some other possibilities.
Both sides trying to attack ! Got to wait.
moves.54. Nxf6+:
Finally, sacking the knight. But..., missed an opportunity!
Instead of sacking,  
    55. ...   Qh5+ 56. Rh6 Knf6+ 57. Kh8 Re8+ 58. Bishop/Queen cover the King but the business is done.
moves.54... Rxf6 55. Re5 Qf7 56. d5 Kh6 57. d6: Getting strong by cruising the Pawn and transferring into a Queen, hopefully.
moves.58... Rf8: In that process, Rook is going to die.
moves.59. Bxf8 Qf6 60. Bxg7+: Again, Black is smart, pushing the Bishop and saving the Rook.
moves.60... Qxg7 61. Re6+ Kh7 62. d8=Q: As desired, new life for the white side with a Queen !
moves.62... Qa1: Giving away the Black Queen. I guess Queen at d1, is happily embrace it.
moves.63. Qxa1:
White side has no option other than to push the only Pawn.
So, Queen will land at a7 quickly and conquer the game .
